NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
Miss Marion E. Corwell
Manager, Educational TV
Henry Ford Museum
Greenfield Village
Dearborn, Michigan
Dear Marion:
Your letter and the speeches for the Speaker's Portfolio arrived yest¬
erday safely,. .which I wanted to let you know, though I haven't yet had
time to go over it carefully.
Right now, it looks as though I will not have an opportunity to get the
stuff finished before the convention. However, I'm hoping to get the
covers printed before then...and we can announce the fact that the insides
are in preparation and that they should be on the lookout for them shortly.
1 11 take a couple of covers along so we can show them what they look like.
This shouldn t hurt anything too much, since we didn't plan to actually
distribute them at the convention anyway.
Harold called the other day about this, and a summary of our conversation
is that we 11 have covers printed for each. We'll send one free copy to
m®mberi fol extras they'll have to pay 2^ each. This
is too bad--that we have to charge, in a way—but the economic facts of life
are that this is the only way we can possibly hope to recover all costs
except the $100 the Board authorized us to spend.
tod thanks for the copy of your announcement of your committee meeting on
Sunday evening. I do hope to attend, unless something occurs to prevent it.
oee you then.
Cordially,
(Mrs.) Betty McKenzie
Publications Editor
